docs.title: iTerm2 Context Switcher
docs.text:
Smart context switching for iTerm2 with auto-profile switching and tab titles.

Version: 2.2.0

docs.title: What It Does
docs.text:
Automatically switches iTerm2 profiles (colors) and sets tab titles based on your current directory:

Context Icon Profile Theme Production 🚨 Production Red AI Sessions 🤖 AI-Session Purple R Package 📦 R-Dev Blue Python 🐍 Python-Dev Green Node.js 📦 Node-Dev Dark Quarto 📊 R-Dev Blue MCP Server 🔌 AI-Session Purple Emacs ⚡ Emacs Purple Dev-Tools 🔧 Dev-Tools Amber

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• ✅ Auto-switch profiles by directory context
  • ✅ Tab titles with icons and git branch: 📦 medfit (main)
  • ✅ Git dirty indicator: 📦 medfit (main)* when uncommitted changes
  • ✅ Production environment warnings (🚨)
  • ✅ Dynamic profiles auto-installed (no manual setup)
  • ✅ Caches state to prevent redundant switches
  • ✅ Zero configuration after setup

docs.title: Option 1: Install Script
docs.text:
cd ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher
bash scripts/install-profiles.sh

docs.title: Option 2: Manual Setup
docs.text:
# Add to ~/.config/zsh/.zshrc (before Oh-My-Zsh loads)
DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"

# At end of .zshrc
source ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher/zsh/iterm2-integration.zsh

Important: Set each iTerm2 profile's Title to "Session Name" in Preferences.

Then reload your shell:

source ~/.config/zsh/.zshrc

See the Installation Guide for detailed setup.

docs.title: How It Works
docs.text:
When you cd into a directory, the integration:

  1. Detects context - Checks for project files (DESCRIPTION, pyproject.toml, etc.)
  2. Switches profile - Changes iTerm2 colors via escape sequence
  3. Sets title - Updates tab title with icon + project name + git branch

Example titles:

  • 📦 medfit (main) - R package on main branch
  • 📦 medfit (main)* - R package with uncommitted changes
  • 🔧 iterm2-context-switcher (dev) - Dev-tools on dev branch
  • 🐍 myproject (feature/api) - Python project on feature branch

All changes are cached to prevent redundant switches.

docs.title: Dynamic Profiles
docs.text:
All 7 color profiles are automatically installed via iTerm2 Dynamic Profiles:

  • R-Dev - Blue theme for R packages
  • AI-Session - Purple theme for Claude/Gemini
  • Production - Red theme for production warning
  • Dev-Tools - Amber/orange theme for shell tools
  • Emacs - Purple/magenta theme for Emacs configs
  • Python-Dev - Green theme for Python projects
  • Node-Dev - Dark theme for Node.js projects

See Profiles Guide for customization.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: Complete installation guide for iTerm2 Context Switcher.

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text:
• iTerm2 (macOS terminal)
  • Zsh shell
  • Git (for project detection)

docs.title: Option 1: Install Script (Recommended)
docs.text:
The fastest way to get started:

cd ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher
bash scripts/install-profiles.sh

This automatically installs all 7 color profiles via iTerm2 Dynamic Profiles.

docs.title: After Running Install Script
docs.text:
1. Add to your .zshrc (before Oh-My-Zsh loads):

    DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"

  2. Add at end of .zshrc:

    source ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher/zsh/iterm2-integration.zsh

  3. Configure iTerm2 profiles (one-time):

    For each installed profile (R-Dev, AI-Session, etc.):

    • Open iTerm2 → Settings → Profiles
    • Select the profile
    • Go to General tab
    • Set Title to: Session Name
    • Check: Applications in terminal may change title

  4. Reload shell:

    source ~/.zshrc

docs.title: Step 1: Install Dynamic Profiles
docs.text:
Copy the profiles JSON to iTerm2:

cp profiles/context-switcher-profiles.json \
   ~/Library/Application\ Support/iTerm2/DynamicProfiles/

docs.title: Step 2: Configure Shell
docs.text:
Add to ~/.config/zsh/.zshrc (or ~/.zshrc):

# Disable OMZ auto-title (MUST be before Oh My Zsh loads)
DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"

# At end of file:
source ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher/zsh/iterm2-integration.zsh

DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE

This must be set before Oh My Zsh or Antidote loads, otherwise OMZ will override your tab titles.

docs.title: Step 3: Configure iTerm2 Title
docs.text:
For each profile (R-Dev, AI-Session, Production, etc.):

  1. Open iTerm2 → Settings → Profiles → General
  2. Set Title to: Session Name
  3. Check: Applications in terminal may change title

Why Session Name?

iTerm2 escape sequences only work when Title is set to "Session Name". Without this, titles will show "zsh" instead of your project name.

docs.title: Step 4: Reload Shell
docs.text: source ~/.zshrc

docs.title: Installed Profiles
docs.text:
The install script adds these 7 profiles:

Profile Theme Use Case R-Dev Blue R packages, Quarto AI-Session Purple Claude/Gemini sessions Production Red Production warning Dev-Tools Amber Shell scripts, CLI tools Emacs Purple Emacs configurations Python-Dev Green Python projects Node-Dev Dark Node.js projects

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Test R package
cd ~/projects/r-packages/active/medfit
# Expected: 📦 medfit (main) with blue theme

# Test default
cd ~
# Expected: Default profile, no icon

# Check hook is registered
type chpwd_iterm_profile

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Title shows "zsh" instead of project name:

  • Set each profile's Title to "Session Name" in iTerm2 Preferences

Profile colors don't change:

  • Verify profile names match exactly (case-sensitive)
  • Check echo $TERM_PROGRAM shows iTerm.app

Git branch not showing:

  • Ensure you're in a git repository
  • Run git branch --show-current to verify

See Troubleshooting Guide for more help.

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get up and running in 2 minutes.

docs.title: Fastest Setup (Recommended)
docs.text:
# 1. Run install script
cd ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher
bash scripts/install-profiles.sh

# 2. Add to your .zshrc
echo 'DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"' >> ~/.zshrc
echo 'source ~/projects/dev-tools/iterm2-context-switcher/zsh/iterm2-integration.zsh' >> ~/.zshrc

# 3. Reload
source ~/.zshrc

# 4. Test
cd ~/projects/r-packages/active/medfit
# Tab should show: 📦 medfit (main)

docs.title: Context Detection
docs.text: How the switcher detects your project type.

docs.title: Detection Priority
docs.text:
Contexts are checked in this order (first match wins):

1. 🚨 Production   (path)        ─┐
2. 🤖 AI-Session   (path)         │ Safety first
3. 📦 R Package    (DESCRIPTION) ─┐
4. 🐍 Python       (pyproject.toml)│ Language-specific
5. 📦 Node         (package.json)  ─┘
6. 📊 Quarto       (_quarto.yml) ─┐
7. 🔌 MCP Server   (mcp-server/)  │
8. ⚡ Emacs        (Cask, etc.)   │ Tool types
9. 🔧 Dev-Tools    (scripts/)    ─┘
10.   Default      (fallback)

docs.title: Path-based Detection
docs.text: Context Path Pattern Profile Production */production/* or */prod/* Production AI Sessions */claude-sessions/* or */gemini-sessions/* AI-Session

docs.title: File-based Detection
docs.text: Context File/Directory Profile R Package DESCRIPTION file with Package: field R-Dev Python pyproject.toml file Python-Dev Node.js package.json file Node-Dev Quarto _quarto.yml file R-Dev MCP Server mcp-server/ directory or *mcp* with package.json AI-Session Emacs Cask, .dir-locals.el, init.el, or early-init.el Emacs Dev-Tools Git repo with commands/ or scripts/ directory Dev-Tools

docs.title: Profile + Icon Summary
docs.text: Context Profile Icon Theme Production Production 🚨 Red AI Sessions AI-Session 🤖 Purple R Package R-Dev 📦 Blue Python Python-Dev 🐍 Green Node.js Node-Dev 📦 Dark Quarto R-Dev 📊 Blue MCP Server AI-Session 🔌 Purple Emacs Emacs ⚡ Purple Dev-Tools Dev-Tools 🔧 Amber Default Default (none) Default

docs.title: Conflict Resolution
docs.text:
When multiple markers exist, the first match wins:

Scenario Winner Why R pkg with Quarto vignettes 📦 R R detected first Python with Makefile 🐍 Python Python detected first Quarto in production folder 🚨 Production Safety priority MCP server with Node 🔌 MCP MCP detected before Node

docs.title: Project Name Extraction
docs.text:
For some contexts, the project name is extracted from files:

Context Source R Package Package: field in DESCRIPTION Node.js "name" field in package.json Quarto title: field in _quarto.yml Others Directory name

docs.title: Dev-Tools Detection
docs.text:
Dev-tools detection requires:

  1. Git repository (.git directory exists)
  2. AND one of:
  3. commands/ directory
  4. scripts/ directory
  5. bin/ directory with Makefile

This prevents false positives (e.g., ~/scripts folder).

docs.title: MCP Server Detection
docs.text:
MCP servers are detected by:

  1. mcp-server/ directory exists, OR
  2. Path contains mcp AND has package.json

docs.title: Important: Title Configuration
docs.text:
For profile switching to work, each profile must have:

  1. General → Title: Set to "Session Name"
  2. Check: "Applications in terminal may change title"

Without this, escape sequences won't update the title.

docs.title: Dynamic Profiles Location
docs.text:
Profiles are stored in:

~/Library/Application Support/iTerm2/DynamicProfiles/context-switcher-profiles.json

docs.title: Custom Dynamic Profiles
docs.text:
Add to the existing JSON file:

{
  "Name": "My-Profile",
  "Guid": "unique-id-here",
  "Dynamic Profile Parent Name": "Default",
  "Background Color": {
    "Red Component": 0.1,
    "Green Component": 0.1,
    "Blue Component": 0.1,
    "Alpha Component": 1
  }
}

docs.title: Troubleshooting
docs.text:
Profile doesn't switch:

  • Ensure $TERM_PROGRAM equals iTerm.app
  • Check profile name matches exactly (case-sensitive)
  • Verify profile exists in iTerm2 Preferences

Title doesn't update:

  • Set Title to "Session Name" in profile settings
  • Enable "Applications in terminal may change title"

docs.title: iTerm2 Triggers
docs.text: Optional triggers for Claude Code notifications.

docs.title: What Are Triggers?
docs.text: iTerm2 triggers watch terminal output and perform actions when patterns match. Use them to get notified when Claude Code needs input.

docs.title: Setting Up Triggers
docs.text:
1. Open iTerm2 → Settings → Profiles → Default
  2. Go to Advanced tab
  3. Click Edit next to Triggers
  4. Add triggers below

docs.title: Notification When Claude Waiting
docs.text: Field Value Regular Expression ^> $ Action Post Notification Parameters Claude waiting for input Instant ✅ Check

docs.title: Bounce Dock on Permission Prompt
docs.text: Field Value Regular Expression (Allow\|Deny)\? Action Bounce Dock Icon Parameters (leave empty) Instant ✅ Check

docs.title: Highlight Permission Lines (Optional)
docs.text: Field Value Regular Expression Do you want to Action Highlight Line Parameters (pick yellow) Instant ✅ Check

docs.title: Available Trigger Actions
docs.text: Action Description Post Notification macOS notification Bounce Dock Icon Bounces until focused Ring Bell Plays sound Highlight Line Colors the line Highlight Text Colors matched text Set Title Changes tab title Show Alert Popup alert box Run Command Execute shell command

docs.title: Inheritance
docs.text:
Triggers set on the Default profile are inherited by child profiles (R-Dev, Python-Dev, etc.) if they use Dynamic Profile Parent Name: Default.

Set triggers once on Default, they work everywhere.

docs.title: Profiles Not Switching
docs.text:
Symptom: Colors don't change when you cd to a project.

Check:

  1. Verify you're in iTerm2: 

    echo $TERM_PROGRAM
# Should show: iTerm.app

  2. Verify profiles exist (exact names, case-sensitive):

  3. R-Dev
  4. Python-Dev
  5. Node-Dev
  6. AI-Session

  7. Production

  8. Verify integration is loaded: 

    typeset -f _iterm_detect_context
# Should show function definition

  9. If not loaded, source it: 

    source ~/.config/zsh/.zshrc

docs.title: Title Not Showing
docs.text:
Symptom: Tab shows "zsh" or directory instead of icon + name.

Check:

  1. iTerm2 title setting:
  2. Settings → Profiles → General → Title

  3. Set to: Session Name

  4. OMZ auto-title disabled: 

    echo $DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE
# Should show: true

  5. If not set, add before antidote/OMZ in .zshrc: 

    DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true"

docs.title: Title Shows Briefly Then Disappears
docs.text:
Symptom: Title flashes correct value then changes.

Cause: Something else is overwriting the title (usually OMZ).

Fix: Ensure DISABLE_AUTO_TITLE="true" is set before plugins load.

docs.title: Loops / Terminal Hangs
docs.text:
Symptom: Terminal freezes after cd.

Fix:

  1. Disable integration temporarily: 

    # Comment out in .zshrc
# source ~/path/to/iterm2-integration.zsh

  2. Open new terminal

  3. Check for conflicting hooks: 

    echo $chpwd_functions

docs.title: Wrong Profile Detected
docs.text:
Symptom: Shows R-Dev but it's a Python project.

Cause: Detection priority - R is checked before Python.

Check: Does the directory have a DESCRIPTION file?

ls DESCRIPTION

If yes, R detection wins. This is by design for R packages with Python scripts.

docs.title: Diagnostic Script
docs.text:
Run the included diagnostic:

~/path/to/iterm2-context-switcher/scripts/diagnose.sh

docs.title: Reset Everything
docs.text:
If all else fails:

# 1. Comment out integration in .zshrc
# 2. Restart terminal
# 3. Clear caches
unset _ITERM_CURRENT_PROFILE
unset _ITERM_CURRENT_TITLE
unset _ITERM_HOOK_REGISTERED

# 4. Re-source
source ~/.config/zsh/.zshrc
